headline: Why Texas Instruments (TXN) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: Shares of analog chip manufacturer Texas Instruments (NASDAQ:TXN) fell 4.5% in the morning session after its Chief Financial Officer cautioned that the recovery in chip demand is not snapping back as strongly as some investors had hoped.

headline: Texas Instruments flags demand slowdown after tariff-driven spike
summary: (Reuters) -U.S. chipmaker Texas Instruments said demand has cooled after a spike in April that was driven by customers rushing to place orders to get ahead of the "Liberation Day" tariff announcement.  Speaking at the Citi Global TMT Conference, TI finance chief Rafael Lizardi said January-to-April strength was partly due to tariff-induced market dynamics ahead of President Donald Trump's April 2 tariff announcement.  Lizardi also said TI has neither been approached about nor discussed any U.S. government equity stake as a condition of CHIPS Act incentives.

Lizardi also said TI has neither been approached about nor discussed any U.S. government equity stake as a condition of CHIPS Act incentives.

headline: 1 Volatile Stock with Exciting Potential and 2 We Avoid
summary: Market swings can be tough to stomach, and volatile stocks often experience exaggerated moves in both directions. While many thrive during risk-on environments, many also struggle to maintain investor confidence when the ride gets bumpy.
